turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: I'm surprised you didn't write one about me.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I'm still working on it.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Remember a few years ago when music schools were using a computerized teaching tool that accidently started frying kids' brains?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: I've been in prison, remember?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: The government must have figured there was no better person to create a psycho than a psycho.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Just like they figured there was no better person to catch one...

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I am the demon from the bottomless pit...

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: ... here on earth to create havoc and terror. I am War, I am death. I am destruction. David Berkowitz, 1977.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I am impressed.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: For murder, though it have no tongue, will speak with most miraculous organ.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Who said that?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Hamlet.  What's David Berkowitz got to do with Sid 6.7?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: He's part of the mix. Sid 6.7 is a composite.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Lindenmeyer put increasingly complex combinations of criminal psychological profiles together to develop the ultimate villain.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Creating a whole far more dangerous than the sum of its parts.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: But rather than selecting pieces from each individual, he simply let the stronger traits of each individual cannibalize the weaker ones.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: This is getting you pumped up, isn't it? This is like the World Series to you.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: As a matter of fact, it is.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Remember the bowling ball bag Sid carried with him in virtual reality?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Dahmer carried the head of one of his victims in a bowling bag for over a week. Kept it in his locker while he was at work in a candy factory.  We need to get a look at Sid 6.7's final profile.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: What we need to do is stop playing with computers and go catch the sonof-a-bitch before he kills anybody else.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: In order to find him, we have to understand what makes him tick...

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Give me your wrist.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Give me a goddam break. I'm not going to go anywhere alone.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: And I'm going to make sure of it.  Give me your wrist.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Told you I wasn't going to go anywhere.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: How did you get your hand out?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me you had a daughter?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I prefer keeping my professional life separate from my personal life.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: She's beautiful, you know?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Thank-you.  Her name is Karin.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Want to tell me the real reason we stopped at your house?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I told you, it was on the way and I wanted to change clothes.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You should practice lying more often. You're awful at it.  Where to?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Sid 6.7 is no longer bound by his programming.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Now that he's in the real world, there are no longer limitations on his behavior like there were in virtual reality. Sid is going to evolve.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Sounds to me like a welleducated way of saying you have no idea what to do next.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: What I do know is that whatever he's becoming, Sid 6.7 is going to be even worse than he was before.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Then all we can do is stay mobile and alert. He's got to make a move sometime, and we've got to be ready when he does.  Welcome to police work. You better like coffee.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: I forgot what real coffee tastes like...

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: You know, considering you've only been out of prison for seven hours, you're readapting quite well.  Wait, I didn't mean that the way it sounded. I meant...

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Don't worry about it, all right?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Dammit, I hate sounding so clinical all the time. All I meant to say was I thought you were doing well, but then I...

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Relax. I know what you meant.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I ruin so many moments by analyzing them when I should just be living them.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Then why don't you start practicing and keep your mouth shut for a while?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Don't get out of the car.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Stop me.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: What the hell's going on?!

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: This is my area of expertise.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: What did you do to those people?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Being on the street's a little different than sitting in an office all day, isn't it?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Enjoying yourself?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You know I am.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: This isn't a game, Parker!

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Tell him.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: What's the problem?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I'm doing the best I can!

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Whatever he was doing here was only the start.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Start of what?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I don't know, yet. What we do know is his performances are increasing in scale, not decreasing.  Whatever it is, he isn't finished...

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: It's not just Sid 6.7's performances that are increasing. Stars need bigger and bigger audiences.  Whatever Sid is going to do next, it's going to involve media.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You like baseball?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Real effective security...

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: You could have just flashed him your badge, you know?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Authority still makes me nervous.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Which way?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Both.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Parker - stop! STOP! Don't make me shoot you

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: If you're gonna do it, better do it now.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Grimes is back! He's back! He's come back!!!

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: No! Grimes isn't back. He's only one part of Sid. Sid 6.7 is a hell of a lot worse than Grimes ever was.  Get a hold of yourself!

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: We know you didn't kill those guards.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: They're going to fry me for it, anyway.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: He didn't know about the neural toxin.  I did.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You knew the entire time? Can you give me one good reason why I shouldn't kill you right now?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: How did you find out about the toxin?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Sid 6.7 told me after he killed the two guards. He suggested I kill you rather than him.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: You're not capable of it.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: I pose an unacceptable danger to the public, remember?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I was wrong.  And I was wrong not to tell you Grimes was part of Sid. I should have told you. I won't make the same mistake again.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: The rally's a little obvious as a target, don't you think?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: I told you before, Grimes liked to be obvious.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Sid 6.7 isn't Grimes.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Part of him is.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: If we find Sid, Lindenmeyer won't be far behind.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Think he's keeping track of his creation?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: That, or living through him...

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: See something?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I'm not sure...on the bridge...the guy at the payphone...

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Nice work.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Find out anything?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: A bomb's going off tomorrow night, but I have no idea where.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Can I ask you something?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You mean there's something you haven't asked me?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: You've already fulfilled the terms of your pardon. You stopped Sid 6.7 and you've got his module. You're free to go  right now.  Why are you going to do this?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You don't know?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: That's why I'm asking.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Because this painintheass criminal psychology expert has helped me understand what I'm capable of. And what I'm not.  And better than anyone else, I am capable of stopping Sid 6.7.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: ...I think so...You?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: More or less.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Lindenmeyer?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: My guess is dead.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Sid?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Where the hell are you going?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Lindenmeyer never got over wanting to kill kids with more musical than he had...

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: How's your pulse?

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: I couldn't tell you.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Then shoot him already.

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: Duck!

turns.speaker: MADISON
turns.text: What do we do now?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You won't want to watch. Turn around.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Where's John?

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: Performing solo.  Enjoying the concert so far?

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: The symphony of collision...

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: The only thing I want to hear is your silence.

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: I must make them very nervous if they let you out of prison.  You know, we have so much in common  we have such history together I've been thinking we should become friends.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You and me have nothing in common.

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: Who else do you know who touches the world with synthetic hands?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You...mother...fucker! I'M GOING TO KILL YOU!!!

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: Now, is that any way to talk to an old buddy? I mean, just because I'm carrying around the joy of killing your family inside me doesn't mean we can't be friends.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: GRIMES, YOU'RE DEAD!

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: I'm sorry, the party you're trying to reach is not answering. Is there anyone else you would like to talk to?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: DEAD! YOU HEAR ME?

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: You really are pathetic, you know that? Mathew Grimes is only one letter in my alphabet. He is nothing compared to me.

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: I wouldn't pull the trigger if I were you

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Why's that?

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: What C-4...was Cox talking about?

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: Let me put it to you this way... whether I'm here...or whether I'm not...I'm leaving an indelible mark on the world tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Where did you plant the C-4?!

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: What C-4...was Cox talking about?

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: Let me put it to you this way... whether I'm here... or whether I'm not...I'm leaving an indelible mark on the world tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Where did you plant the C-4?!

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You can't die until you tell me where the C-4 is. Where is it?!

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: My...secret.

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: It's really too bad you have to miss the Grand Finale.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: I thought you liked me being in the audience. Don't you want me to see it?

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: There you go  best seat in the house.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: You are going after Mayor Bennett.

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: Let's just say I'm sending a very clear message to his ReElection Rally...

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Aren't you going to watch with me?

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: I've got some final preparations to take care of Checking his watch, he stops suddenly.

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: Thank-you, Daryl.  You had me going for quite a while there, sport.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: I really did think I was still in reality. At least, until now.  Beam me up, Scotty!

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Now, is that any way to talk to an old friend?

turns.speaker: SID 6.7
turns.text: BARNES, YOU'RE DEAD!

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: To the first LETAC engineer to go into production on prototypes.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: As long as you keep overpaying me, I'll be the first to go into production on three, and four, as well.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: As long as they keep overpaying me, I'll keep overpaying you.  ) Just make goddam sure you can have 10 of them ready for deployment around the city by next month.

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: Mr. Wallace, I could have 10 of them ready by tomorrow.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Do they have to look so...robotic?

turns.speaker: REILLY
turns.text: At this stage, you either get form or function. You said she wanted function. I gave you function. What are you complaining about?

turns.speaker: AIDE
turns.text: You want some research, flu?  Side-effects of medi....

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Naw, we can't play this one catch-up.  That's how long since you stopped beating the wife.  We have to...

turns.speaker: AIDE
turns.text: ...tonight...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: You're with him tonight, watching the President's Speech, when the President...

turns.speaker: AIDE
turns.text: What if he's busy tonight?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: <u>Lure</u> him.

turns.speaker: AIDE
turns.text: What are you saying...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Well, darlin' <u>I</u> ain't your confessor.  Tell him you've got some info on the President's sex scandal, it's on your conscience, believe me, he'll drop what he's doing.  Okay;  <u>Now</u>:  Folks, folks, folks, this is a shitty business, and it needs no Ghost Come From the Grave to tell us that.  But in Six Days, Lord willing n'Jesus Tarries, I am going to take you beauties into the second term. .....wait til you hear the speech tonight.  The 3-0-3 Speech... where's the Fad King, by the way...

turns.speaker: AIDE
turns.text: ...on the way in.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: When you...  What?  I'm busy.

turns.speaker: AIDE
turns.text: It's the White House.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: <u>Hello</u>.  What?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: What about it?

turns.speaker: AIDE
turns.text: For Schumann.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Well, well, well, well, wait a minute, we got 86 percent.  We bring'em back <u>tomorrow</u>, the charts go up, they don't go <u>down</u>...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Waal, Mr. Moss, I wouldn't....

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: You wouldn't be here if it wasn't true.  It's true, right?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Alright, well, alright:  geopolitically...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: We've just found out They Have the Bomb.  We've Just Found Out They Have The <u>Bomb</u>, aaaand... No, No wait a second, no, no, wait a second, No.  The Bomb's not... it's not <u>there</u> -- because they'd have to have a rocket and that shit n'they're a buncha wogs-- it's ... it's a <u>suitcase</u> Bomb.  Ooookay.  It's a <u>suitcase</u> bomb, and it's .... in Canada!  Eh?  Albanian Terrorists have placed a suitcase Bomb in Canada, in an attempt to infiltrate the bomb into the USA.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: You know what?  This is good.  This is terrific, and I'll tell you why:  it's <u>cost effective</u>.  This is....

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: It's <u>producing</u>.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: No, this is great.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: I could tell you stories:  Cecil B. Demille:  Alright? The Greatest Show on Earth:  He needs an elephant,

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Ames here.  <u>Yessir</u>...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Okay.  Okay.  The <u>Suitcase</u> Bomb...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: The <u>thinking</u> is, as of this moment, <u>Terrorism</u>...  ...they're getting a Good Reaction on the "Albania" thing...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Hello, <u>King</u>.  How the heck <u>are</u> you...?  <u>Get</u> out...  <u>Get</u> out... Well, man, you fall in love like a <u>Hillbilly</u>...  Ditch the wife, toss the kids in the Pick-up,   Listen, King:  <u>Get</u> your fat redneck ass out here, <u>willya</u>...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...but the President wonders about the Possible Albanian Backlash...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Y'see, <u>this</u> is what Producing is:  you put me in a <u>Room</u>...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...and he's got a <u>negative</u> rating of...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: King, we've got to be on the streets in...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: NY Times, Washington Post, War, War, War.  Times got the girlscout page twelve, Post in Section Two.... Horses in Mid-Stream...?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: I don't think you're gonna need it.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Well, we paid for it, we got the guys on a retainer.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: They got the guys on a <u>retainer</u>, it's cheaper, <u>pay</u>'em, but don't lettem touch it... Let'em leave us alone.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: What can it hurt.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: What can it hurt is they offend me.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Okay.  Here's what we're gonna do.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: I need a little bit of <u>help</u>...?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Miss, we are going to ask you to sign this little sheet of <u>paper</u>...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: And...she's not an Illegal Immigrant?  Is she?  Can I see her "chart?"  Because...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Gonna be fine.  Gonna be fine, people?  Are we getting there...?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: A small, "calico" kitten, sir.  "Calico."

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...can we have a white one...?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Can we have a white one, please...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: A new <u>take</u> on the...  Well, sir, we're coming back, we'd like you to try it out, this evening...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Listen to what I've ... listen to... does anybody know Morse Code?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...this is a snappy song....

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: What'd ya think?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Hey, hey, I'm just the Producer, I'm just the <u>Stationmaster</u>, Johnny Green wrote that song, and...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: All we have to do now is sell it to the President.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Mr. President, this is St...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Hi, How are ya?  <u>Listen</u> to this, willya...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: ...mmm?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: It's the gratitude of your <u>party</u>, and of your <u>President</u>...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Izzat the thing...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Indeed it is.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...The Albanian Campaign...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: ...like the <u>sound</u> of it, eh...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: We've got to put that, into the Inaugural.  "I have here, a ribbon.  You haven't seen it before, and you will not see it too often <u>now</u>.  For it is the Proud Possession of a few, a very few Men and Women... it is the Ribbon of the Albanian Campaign...."

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Wilfred, that's not bad.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: He, uh, has he been in the "jail" long?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: ...twelve years.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Much more...uh, he have much more time to "serve?"

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Yeeaahhh...  Ohmigod ... ohmigod... ohmigod...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: And?  NO.  I don't wanna know.  What do you <u>mean</u> "and..."?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Look, look, look....  He's fine, as long as he has his medication.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: What happens if he doesn't have his medication?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: He's not fine.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Well, get on the phone, and <u>get</u> it...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: You know, I think you people are looking at this All Wrong.  If you look at the <u>backstory</u> -- the guy's coming back from Combat and Torture.  Of <u>course</u> he is gonna be ... uh ... uh ... "fucked up".  Of <u>Course</u> he's gonna "need a little help"...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Oh, Lord....

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: <u>IT DESTROYED THE ELECTORAL PROCESS</u>.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...where?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...his Triumphal Plane.  Shot Down.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Shot down, Forced down...  You guys are <u>missing</u> it... You're missing the <u>opportunity</u>

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: You can't tell this story.  He's not kidding you.  You can't tell this story.  <u>You</u> knew that.  The pay off was, you get to be Ambassador, or...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: No, no, no...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: ...how do we Explain That?  Hey?  Am I worried...?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...how do we explain that?  With the World Watching.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: <u>Fuck</u> the world.  Try a ten A.M. <u>pitch</u> meeting, no sleep, coked-to-the-gills, and you haven't even read the <u>material</u>.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: But how do we explain the fact he was in prison?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: How do we explain that?  Ah, well, you see, Wilfred, this is where you've never been at a <u>pitch</u>.  You see? His <u>records</u> say he was in prison ... as they must, as <u>all</u> the records of Group 303 have the men and the women, carried on their roster, as belonging somewhere else, the <u>secrecy</u> required of....

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: I'm concerned about the driver of the rig.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: What rig?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...the Harvester...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Naa, fuck this, this is nothing.  Oh, Lord -- this just got <u>Big</u>.  I see it -- <u>Big</u> -- Big for <u>you</u> and big for <u>me</u>.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: You're not <u>thinking</u> right, Pal...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: He's <u>dead</u>.  He's <u>dead</u>.  The Fella Killed Old Shoe.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: And <u>what</u> is bigger than a triumphal Homecoming...?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Who we got here...?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: John Levy, Staff, and Amy Cain, Press Off....

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Alright.  Look here, any of you kids hear in this room:  what you hear here, what you say here, what you <u>do</u> here, f'it got out, you leaked it.  Tell'em what they need to know.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: When it broke, he said one word:  get me Ronnie Brean.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Well.  Alright.  What is it?  What's, he, uh...?  He had an Illegal Immigrant, was his Gardener, some years back...?  What's the thing?  You people get ahead, you sure get nervous.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Three minutes.  It couldn't have been over three minutes, the Secret Service...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Okay.  And she's alleging...?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: We are virtually certain it isn't...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Who's got the story?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Don't you want to know if it's true?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: What difference does it make if it's true?  It's a <u>story</u>, and, it <u>breaks</u> they're gonna have to <u>run</u> with it -- How long've we got til it breaks?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Front page.  Washington Post.  Tomorrow.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Well, yeah.  Now.  That's not good.  <u>Okay</u>:  <u>Okay</u>.  We'll set up the War Room <u>Here</u>...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: When do we bring'em back?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: You gotta give me a day.  I need a day.  He's sick, get it out <u>now</u>.  Get him on the phone'n tell him how sick he is.  We got to get it out before the story breaks, so we aren't quote, responding to it. Issue is as a bulletin.  He's got some rare strain of...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: It won't hold.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: All I need is the one day.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: It won't even hold the one day, Ronnie --

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Yes -- It will... Now:  why is the President in China?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: We're going to have to explain away the...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: They caught him in the closet with a Girlscout.  Side- effects of a pill ain't gone trump that.  You have to keep'em guessing for  Two weeks.  You  don't have to Cure Cancer, Pal, you just have to give them something more interesting than...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Car and a driver, Mr. Brean, the Westgate, Now, please...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Okay, look, who's takin' the press conference today?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: What crisis?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: I'm working on it.  Same time, you call Billy Scott at Joint Chiefs, and pour him onna plane <u>right now</u> to Seattle, y'got that...?  All flustered and worried. To talk to the <u>Boeing</u> people.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: <u>Do</u> it...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: And you?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: It won't hold.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: One day, Two days?  <u>Course</u> it's gonna hhhh....

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: It won't hold, Ronnie, it won't prove out.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: We don't need it to prove out.  We need it to <u>distract</u> them for two weeks til the election.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: What would do that...?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: What in the <u>world</u> would do that?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: I'm working on it.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Gimme twenty thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: I'll be back within the hour.  Now,

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: It's going to be fine.  It's going to be ... you remember in 88, when...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: It's the rough-cut, the other side's new commercial.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Twenty thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Yeah, I'm gonna have to go to L.A.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Gemme a plane.  Business Aviation, National, one hour. Fly to Chicago.  O'hare, LAX 6 A.M.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: I'll see you at National.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Tell, tell, tell me again.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: ....we landing?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Tell me again.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Lookit, don't worry about it.  It's not a New Concept. Wake me when we touch down, will...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: We can't <u>afford</u> a war.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: We aren't going to have a war.  We're going to have the "appearance" of a war.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: I'm not sure we can afford to have the "appearance" of a war.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: What's it gonna cost?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: But, but, but, "they" would find out.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Who would find out?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: The American "people"?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Yes

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Who's gonna tell'em.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: What did they find out about the Gulf War?  One shot: one bomb, falling though the roof, building coulda been made of <u>Legos</u>.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...you want us to go to War...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: ...that's the general idea.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Why <u>not</u>, what've they ever done for <u>us</u>...?  Also:  they sound... Ah, you see, this is why we have to mobilize the B-2 <u>Bomber</u>...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...they sound what?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: <u>Shifty</u>.  Who knows anything <u>about</u> em...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Hold on, hold on, hold on:

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Well, I'm gonna hold on, but you went to win this election, you better change the subject.  You wanna change this subject, you better have a War.  What do you need?  It's gotta be <u>quick</u>, it's gotta be <u>dramatic</u>, you got to have an <u>enemy</u>.  Okay?  What do you need in an enemy?  Somebody you fear.  Who do you fear? Som'b'y you don't know.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: <u>Who</u>?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Well, I'm <u>working</u> on it....

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: What do you know about them?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...<u>nothing</u>...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Precisely.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: What did Albania ever do to us?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: What did they ever do <u>for</u> us...?  You see, this is why we have to mobilize the B-2 Bomber.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...you want us to go to War with Albania.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Here's what you got to do:  Get your Press Office, Right now.  To deny;  There <u>is</u> no report of Albanian Activity.  They have to deny it. Now, get the C.I.A.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...where is the Back End coming from?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: It's like that thing with the Yellow Ribbon...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: The thing with the Yellow Ribbon...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: The Hostages...?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: The hostages, but that was a naturally-occuring...  It was a put-up job?  But where was the, where was the money in that?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: In the yellow ribbon.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...the Yellow Ribbon, but who, who'd profit from <u>that</u>...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: The Ribbon Manufacturers.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...can we see the Kitten...?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: <u>Hello</u>... Yes.  We'll be back...?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: We'll be back tonight.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Tonight.  Well, you've started a Tempest in a Teapot.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Waal, that's where you <u>want</u> em...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...I just hope...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Why is this putz on the air...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ... they're checking the ratings...uh...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...hell of a price for the country to pay.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: ...take a long view.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...what's the Long View?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Your guy gets four more years in Washington...  ...it's only Nine More Days.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Yes.  That's true.  But...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Wilfred.  We've got <u>work</u> to do...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: New York Times, Wash Post, Detroit Register, San Diego BEE, all in emission.  <u>No</u> mention of the Girlscout. None.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Eight Days To Go

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: I <u>live</u> for midnight, when I can tear another of those suckers off.  Watcha got for me?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Big Bird touches down <u>when</u>?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: We're bring'n im in tomorrow, five AM.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Anything at the Airport?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Press thought "no," whaddaya think...?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: <u>I</u> think, here's what I think:  S'it gonna rain...?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Gimme the weather for tomorrow morning, five A.M. Andrews...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: An <u>Albanian</u>, a young Albanian Girl.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: No rain.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: A young Albanian Girl, dressed in their...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: And carrying.  The National Flower of Albania, something..... Now Is it some Festival?  Some <u>Harvest</u> Festival, something...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Get on this, right now...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: ...got to be <u>something</u>.  She gives him the sacred...  And tells him:  this is the Traditional Harvest Offering, given to the Man who Ties the First Sheaf, the last sheaf, whatever the fuck it is...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...this's <u>good</u>...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Stanley Moss, Ladeesngennlmen... And she says...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Is she saying this in Albanian...?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: <u>Yes</u>:  she is saying this in Albanian, <u>but</u> she's doing it not to be uh...  But because, she explains, that is the only way it can be understood by her Aged and Sainted Mother, who is standing there with her, dressed in her Traditional...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Our adopted land...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: ...but to the Old World; you are stilling the forces of hatred and of War which have, since I was a child...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: ...uh huh...

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Now, the Old Lady starts to <u>Weep</u>, Big Bird shrugs off his secret <u>Service</u>, goes to her, and covers her with his own coat.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Find out is there <u>any</u> chance we can get some rain tomorrow, <u>will</u> you...?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: <u>So</u> forth...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Catching up on his reading.  Asked about you, sends his thanks.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Knock on wood.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Speaking of thanks... we puttem back in, what does your fellow Moss want?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: <u>I</u> dunno.... Ambassador to <u>Togo</u>, somethin', <u>I</u> dunno... he...

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: Maybe he's just a <u>patriot</u>.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Yeah...what was I talking about...?

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: How long you been up, you need a nap.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Due in Nashville.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: <u>Nashville</u>...?

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: We're gonna do the <u>Team Song</u>.

turns.speaker: AMES
turns.text: You're tired, Ronnie.

turns.speaker: BREAN
turns.text: Y'wanna follow the Cattle Drive?  Sleep in the Winter. What does <u>Moss</u> want...?  Matchmaker comes to the Levinsky Family.  Mr. Levinsky, Mrs. Levinsky, would you entertain an offer of marriage for your son Saul, from Princess Margaret of Great Britain.  Well, they think, she isn't Jewish, but she's well to-do, a nice old family.  Alright, yes, they say.  We would consider such an offer.  Wonderful, matchmaker says, My Job is Half Done.  Now, Look:  I got the <u>file</u>, from the L.A. contingent, I got the day-by-day, of how...
